title: DataStax Asked: What Do Developers Think?
description: While at ApacheCon 2019, we asked developers what they thought about Apache Cassandra and where they see it is   headed next! Stay tuned for more insights from the C* Developer Community, here on DataStax Developers.

transcript.text: [Music] it's getting better and I think a big part of that is the community the ecosystem so data stacks insta cluster the last pickle those are all great resources and just like a lot of contributors to the open-source project there's proposals to build an official sidecar project and just kind of kind of pointing out the areas where it's not it's still not quite user friendly and but it feels like you know it's just constant sort of incremental change it's good so woe understanding how to get the highest performance out of it if performance tuning understanding the the impact of great latencies and and and scaling out the database and and in general cram out as much performance as you can that's a hot that's not easy use it try it that's the thing you have to actually get your hands on it leveraging the resources that are out there so things like data stacks Academy are great the Apache documentation is great and getting better and and I think reaching out to people on social media to like there's a good community presence on sites like Twitter anyone should they should go to the data stacks you know documentation and what do you call it like tutorials and stuff that's where I learned all my stuff I'm really excited about data stacks enterprise and about the graph database capabilities and reaching scales of vertices and edges that are currently still theoretical but possible you know there's an old saying that most databases take ten years to establish them cells and we are kind of getting there with Cassandra so I think Cassandra is about to hit its real stride now and I think there's a lot of very positive things going on in the environment with next generations and a potential move to a storage engine architecture I think that can really kick it into high gear
